com.googlecode.n_orm.hbase

Class Store

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.googlecode.n_orm.hbase.Store
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ActionnableStore, GenericStore, Store

    public class Store
extends Object
implements Store, ActionnableStore, GenericStore
    The HBase store found according to its configuration folder. An example store.properties file is:
    class=com.googlecode.n_orm.hbase.Store
    static-accessor=getStore
    1=/usr/lib/hbase/conf/
    Given files adn directories are explored recursively ignoring files given with a ! prefix. You can also define (positive or negative with a ! prefix) filters using wilcards such as * (any character set), ? (any character), and ** (any sub-directory) can be used both in included and excluded patterns (see DirectoryScanner), but at least one directory to look in must be defined without wildcard. Two attempts are performed during search: first explicitly looking for ./*-site.xml and ./conf/*-site.xml, and then all possible ** /*-site.xml. hbase-site.xml MUST be found for the operation to succeed. Compared to HBase, no jar found in those is added to classpath. For test purpose, you can also directly reach an HBase instance thanks to one of its zookeeper host and client port:
    class=com.googlecode.n_orm.hbase.Store
    static-accessor=getStore
    1=localhost
    2=2181
    compression=gz #can be 'none', 'gz', 'lzo', or 'snappy' (default is 'none') ; in the latter two cases, take great care that those compressors are available for all nodes of your hbase cluster
    One important property to configure is setScanCaching(Integer).
    Most properties can be overloaded at class or column-family level by using the annotation HBaseSchema. This store supports remote processes (see Process.processElementsRemotely(Class, Constraint, Process, Callback, int, String[], int, long) and SearchableClassConstraintBuilder.remoteForEach(Process, Callback, int, long)) as it implements ActionnableStore by using HBase/Hadoop Map-only jobs. However, be careful when configuring your hadoop: all jars containing your process and n-orm (with dependencies) should be available. By default, all known jars are sent (which might become a problem is same jars are sent over and over). You can change this using e.g. setMapRedSendJars(boolean).

      • setCacheTTLMs

        public void setCacheTTLMs(long cacheTTLMs)
        Schema for table are cached ; indicates time (in ms) when cache is reloaded (default is 10min). New value will be considered after next reload.

      • setMaxRetries

        public void setMaxRetries(int maxRetries)
        The number of times this store can retry connecting the cluster. Default value is HBase default value (10).
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - in case the sent value is less that 1

        public void setClientTimeout(Integer clientTimeout)

      • getScanCaching

        public Integer getScanCaching()
        The number of elements that this store scans at once during a search.
        Returns:
        the expected value, or null if not set (equivalent to the HBase default value - 1 - see the HBase documentation)

      • setScanCaching

        public void setScanCaching(Integer scanCaching)
        The number of elements that this store scans at once during a search. Default value is HBase default value (1). Use this carefully ; read the HBase documentation.

      • getDeferredLogFlush

        public Boolean getDeferredLogFlush()
        Whether HTableDescriptor.setDeferredLogFlush(boolean) should be set for tables. Improves write throughput by making writes log asynchronous on the server while improving risk of data loss in case of server crash. Default value is HBase default value (false). Use this carefully ; read the HBase documentation.

      • setDeferredLogFlush

        public void setDeferredLogFlush(Boolean deferredLogFlush)
        Whether HTableDescriptor.setDeferredLogFlush(boolean) should be set for tables. Improves write throughput by making writes log asynchronous on the server while improving risk of data loss in case of server crash. Default value is HBase default value (false). Use this carefully ; read the HBase documentation.

      • isForceDeferredLogFlush

        public boolean isForceDeferredLogFlush()
        Whether existing tables have to be altered if they don't have the proper deferredLogFlush property.
        See Also:
        getDeferredLogFlush()

      • setForceDeferredLogFlush

        public void setForceDeferredLogFlush(boolean forceDeferredLogFlush)
        Whether existing tables have to be altered if they don't use the correct deferredLogFlush property. Default value is false. Be careful with this parameter as if two process have a store on the same cluster each with isForceDeferredLogFlush() to true and different values for getDeferredLogFlush() : tables might be altered in an endless loop ! Note that altering a table takes some time as it must be disabled and enabled again, so use this with care.
        See Also:
        getDeferredLogFlush()

      • getMapRedScanCaching

        public int getMapRedScanCaching()
        The number of elements that this store scans at once during a Map/Reduce task (see the HBase documentation).
        See Also:
        Process.processElementsRemotely(Class, Constraint, Process, Callback, int, String[], int, long), SearchableClassConstraintBuilder.remoteForEach(Process, Callback, int, long)

      • setMapRedScanCaching

        public void setMapRedScanCaching(int mapRedScanCaching)

      • getCompression

        public String getCompression()
        The used compression for this store. Compression is used when creating a column family in the HBase cluster. In case you set setForceCompression(boolean) to true, existing column families are also checked and altered if necessary.
        Returns:
        the used compression, or null if not set (equivalent to the HBase default value - none)

      • setCompression

        public void setCompression(String compression)
        The used compression for this store. Default value is the HBase default (none). Compression is used when creating a column family in the HBase cluster. In case you set setForceCompression(boolean) to true, existing column families are also checked and altered if necessary. You can test for LOCALLY available compressors using tested_ prefix (e.g. tested_lzo-or-gz).

      • getCompressionAlgorithm

        public org.apache.hadoop.hbase.io.hfile.Compression.Algorithm getCompressionAlgorithm()

      • getCompressionByName

      • isForceCompression

        public boolean isForceCompression()
        Whether existing columns have to be altered if they don't use the correct compressor.
        See Also:
        getCompression()

      • setForceCompression

        public void setForceCompression(boolean forceCompression)
        Whether existing columns have to be altered if they don't use the correct compressor. Default value is false. Be careful with this parameter as if two process have a store on the same cluster each with isForceCompression() to true and different values for getCompression() : column families might be altered in an endless loop ! Note that altering a column family takes some time as tables must be disabled and enabled again, so use this with care.
        See Also:
        getCompression()

      • setBloomFilterType

        public void setBloomFilterType(org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.StoreFile.BloomType bloomFilterType)
        Whether created tables should have HColumnDescriptor.setBloomFilterType(org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.StoreFile.BloomType) set. Default value is equivalent to HColumnDescriptor.DEFAULT_BLOOMFILTER null is considered as unset (i.e. the default value).

      • setBlockCacheEnabled

        public void setBlockCacheEnabled(Boolean blockCacheEnabled)
        Whether created tables should have HColumnDescriptor.setBlockCacheEnabled(boolean) set. Default value is equivalent to HColumnDescriptor.DEFAULT_BLOCKCACHE null is considered as unset (i.e. the default value).

      • isForceBlockCacheEnabled

        public boolean isForceBlockCacheEnabled()
        Whether existing columns have to be altered if they don't use the correct HColumnDescriptor.setBlockCacheEnabled(boolean) setting.
        See Also:
        getBlockCacheEnabled()

      • setForceBlockCacheEnabled

        public void setForceBlockCacheEnabled(boolean forceBlockCacheEnabled)
        Whether existing columns have to be altered if they don't use the correct HColumnDescriptor.setBlockCacheEnabled(boolean) setting. Be careful with this parameter as if two process have a store on the same cluster each with isForceBlockCacheEnabled() to true and different values for getBlockCacheEnabled() : column families might be altered in an endless loop ! Note that altering a column family takes some time as tables must be disabled and enabled again, so use this with care.
        See Also:
        getBlockCacheEnabled()

      • getBlockSize

        public Integer getBlockSize()
        Whether created tables should have HColumnDescriptor.setBlocksize(int) set.

      • setBlockSize

        public void setBlockSize(Integer blockSize)
        Whether created tables should have HColumnDescriptor.setBlocksize(int) set. Default value is equivalent to HColumnDescriptor.DEFAULT_BLOCKSIZE null is considered as unset (i.e. the default value).

      • isForceBlockSize

        public boolean isForceBlockSize()
        Whether existing columns have to be altered if they don't use the correct HColumnDescriptor.setBlocksize(int) setting.
        See Also:
        getBlockCacheEnabled()

      • setForceBlockSize

        public void setForceBlockSize(boolean forceBlockSize)
        Whether existing columns have to be altered if they don't use the correct HColumnDescriptor.setBlocksize(int) setting. Be careful with this parameter as if two process have a store on the same cluster each with isForceBlockSize() to true and different values for getBlockSize() : column families might be altered in an endless loop ! Note that altering a column family takes some time as tables must be disabled and enabled again, so use this with care.
        See Also:
        getBlockSize()

      • getReplicationScope

        public Integer getReplicationScope()
        Whether created tables should have HColumnDescriptor.setScope(int) set.

      • setReplicationScope

        public void setReplicationScope(Integer replicationScope)
        Whether created tables should have HColumnDescriptor.setScope(int) set. Default value is equivalent to HColumnDescriptor.DEFAULT_REPLICATION_SCOPE null or <= 0 or >=2 is considered as unset (i.e. the default value).

      • isForceReplicationScope

        public boolean isForceReplicationScope()
        Whether existing columns have to be altered if they don't use the correct HColumnDescriptor.setScope(int) setting.
        See Also:
        getReplicationScope()

      • setForceReplicationScope

        public void setForceReplicationScope(boolean forceReplicationScope)
        Whether existing columns have to be altered if they don't use the correct HColumnDescriptor.setScope(int) setting. Be careful with this parameter as if two process have a store on the same cluster each with isForceReplicationScope() to true and different values for getReplicationScope() : column families might be altered in an endless loop ! Note that altering a column family takes some time as tables must be disabled and enabled again, so use this with care.
        See Also:
        getReplicationScope()

      • isCountMapRed

        public boolean isCountMapRed()
        Whether counts (e.g. count(MetaInformation, String, Constraint)) should use a map/reduce job.

      • setCountMapRed

        public void setCountMapRed(boolean countMapRed)
        Whether counts (e.g. count(MetaInformation, String, Constraint)) should use a map/reduce job. Default value is false. Map/reduce jobs are usually hard to run, so if this method is faster in case of large data on large cluster, it should be avoided on small clusters.

      • isTruncateMapRed

        public boolean isTruncateMapRed()
        Whether truncates (e.g. truncate(MetaInformation, String, Constraint)) should use a map/reduce job.

      • setTruncateMapRed

        public void setTruncateMapRed(boolean truncateMapRed)
        Whether truncates (e.g. truncate(MetaInformation, String, Constraint)) should use a map/reduce job. Default value is false. Map/reduce jobs are usually hard to run, so if this method is faster in case of large data on large cluster, it should be avoided on small clusters.

      • isMapRedSendJobJars

        public boolean isMapRedSendJobJars()
        Whether jar files containing sent jobs should be sent to the Hadoop Map/Reduce cluster while performing a Map/Reduce job.

      • setMapRedSendJobJars

        public void setMapRedSendJobJars(boolean mapRedSendJars)
        Whether jar files containing sent jobs should be sent to the Hadoop Map/Reduce cluster while performing a Map/Reduce job. Default value is true. Setting this parameter to false will improve map/reduce tasks setup, but you might face ClassNotFoundException on task tracker nodes if their CLASSPATH is not configured properly. To be used with care !

      • isMapRedSendNOrmJars

        public boolean isMapRedSendNOrmJars()
        Whether jar files containing n-orm and the n-orm HBase driver should be sent to the Hadoop Map/Reduce cluster while performing a Map/Reduce job.

      • setMapRedSendNOrmJars

        public void setMapRedSendNOrmJars(boolean mapRedSendJars)
        Whether jar files containing n-orm and the n-orm HBase driver should be sent to the Hadoop Map/Reduce cluster while performing a Map/Reduce job. Default value is true. Setting this parameter to false will improve map/reduce tasks setup, but you might face ClassNotFoundException on task tracker nodes if their CLASSPATH is not configured properly. To be used with care !

      • isMapRedSendHBaseJars

        public boolean isMapRedSendHBaseJars()
        Whether jar files containing the HBase client should be sent to the Hadoop Map/Reduce cluster while performing a Map/Reduce job.

      • setMapRedSendHBaseJars

        public void setMapRedSendHBaseJars(boolean mapRedSendJars)
        Whether jar files containing the HBase client should be sent to the Hadoop Map/Reduce cluster while performing a Map/Reduce job. Default value is true. Setting this parameter to false will improve map/reduce tasks setup, but you might face ClassNotFoundException on task tracker nodes if their CLASSPATH is not configured properly. To be used with care !

      • setMapRedSendJars

        public void setMapRedSendJars(boolean mapRedSendJars)
        Whether jar files containing HBase, n-orm, the n-orm HBase driver and sent job should be sent to the Hadoop Map/Reduce cluster while performing a Map/Reduce job. Default value is true. Setting this parameter to false will improve map/reduce tasks setup, but you might face ClassNotFoundException on task tracker nodes if their CLASSPATH is not configured properly. To be used with care !

      • getConf

        public org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration getConf()
        The configuration used by this store. You can only trust this method is this store was explicitly set the host before or started. This method provides a mean to have greater control over HBase and Hadoop.

      • getLaunchProps

        public Properties getLaunchProps()

      • setConf

        public void setConf(org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration configuration)
        The configuration to be used by this store for its start() or restart(). Only valid when store is not started yet. Overloads any other configuration setting already set by getStore(String), getStore(String, int), getStore(String, int, Integer), or getAdmin(). Ignored in case of a subsequent setAdmin(HBaseAdmin). Changed when invoked start() or restart().
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if this store was started already

      • getAdmin

        public org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client.HBaseAdmin getAdmin()

      • setAdmin

        public void setAdmin(org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client.HBaseAdmin admin)
        Sets the HBase admin object. Only valid before the store is started.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - in case this store is already started

      • restart

        public void restart()
        Resets the connection to HBase. Also vacuum any cached value about the store (but not Cached elements from Cache). This method is thread-safe ; if a restart is already ongoing, the methods block until restart is done.
